title: Authors and Citation
text: Miriam Rainers. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rainers M (2025). stdatadict: Create Data Dictionary Variable Selection File SecuTrial Export. R package version 0.2.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {stdatadict: Create Data Dictionary or Variable Selection File from SecuTrial Export},   author = {Miriam Rainers},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.0}, }

what: Create Data Dictionary or Variable Selection File from SecuTrial Export
title: Create Data Dictionary or Variable Selection File from SecuTrial Export
text: R package provides functions creating data dictionary variable selection excel file based metadata files Secutrial data export additional files provided user. data dictionary basically compact form “Datensatztabelle/Data Set Table” Secutrial. Since created exported meta data holds information variables forms included export. Furthermore information data capture rules (e.g. circumstances variable shown data capture) unit conversion factors, since data also available export metadata. extract informations sources add form item tables, creation process. variables selection table broadly speaking, data dictionay based full export, select column attached form item tables. ‘select’ column however can hold less complex check rules, makes possible user select entire variable groups. package builds upon following R packages: openxlsx2 creating excel file. shiny.i18n language switching. Automatic translation questions, item labels etc. implemented. happily given enough time provided api key google.translate, DeepL translation tool.

title: Create Data Dictionary or Variable Selection File from SecuTrial Export
text: Create Personal Access Token Gitlab scope: read_api. Save token later use. Install remotes package. Install development version openxlsx2.current stable version CRAN (version 1.0) critical bug fixed development version.
code: if (!rlang::is_installed("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("JanMarvin/openxlsx2")

title: Create Data Dictionary or Variable Selection File from SecuTrial Export
text: Install stdatadict gitlab dependent packages. can also store access token later use R’s system environment variable. install_gitlab() automatically uses stored token access gitlab.
code: library(remotes)  install_gitlab(   repo = "medinf/kvf/kardio/dzhk/num-transferstelle/stdatadict",   host = "https://gitlab-pe.gwdg.de",   auth_token = "<YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN>",   dependencies = TRUE ) Sys.setenv(GITLAB_PAT = "<YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN>")  install_gitlab(   repo = "medinf/kvf/kardio/dzhk/num-transferstelle/stdatadict",   host = "https://gitlab-pe.gwdg.de",   dependencies = TRUE )

what: Create a New Data Dictionary Color Theme — add_color_theme
title: Create a New Data Dictionary Color Theme — add_color_theme
text: Define new color theme data dictionary workbook, based color definition template theme. define parameters deviate template. newly defined color theme added list available themes use_theme = TRUE use new theme creating data dictionary excel workbook. Use ls_color_themes() list currently available themes.

title: Create a New Data Dictionary Color Theme — add_color_theme
code: add_color_theme(   name,   template = "purpur",   use_theme = TRUE,   bg_primary = NULL,   font_primary = NULL,   bg_subtitle = NULL,   font_subtitle = NULL,   bg_h1 = NULL,   font_h1 = NULL,   bg_tablehead = NULL,   font_tablehead = NULL,   bg_visit = NULL,   font_visit = NULL,   bg_tablecol_overview = NULL,   font_tablecol_overview = NULL,   bg_tablecol_items = NULL,   font_tablecol_items = NULL,   border_tablecol_items = NULL,   font_hidden = NULL,   bg_select_column = NULL,   font_select_column = NULL,   border_select_column = NULL )

title: Create a New Data Dictionary Color Theme — add_color_theme
text: name new color theme template name color theme new theme inherits color values. default "purpur". use_theme logical. newly defined theme used workbook? Default = TRUE bg_primary character color name RGB hex code: background document form titles font_primary character color name RGB hex code: font color document form titles bg_subtitle character color name RGB hex code: background subtitle font_subtitle character color name RGB hex code: font color subtitle bg_h1 character color name RGB hex code: background heading font_h1 character color name RGB hex code: font color heading bg_tablehead character color name RGB hex code: background column names font_tablehead character color name RGB hex code: font color column names bg_visit character color name RGB hex code: background visit names font_visit character color name RGB hex code: font color visit names bg_tablecol_overview character color name RGB hex code: background table names form overview font_tablecol_overview character color name RGB hex code: font color table names form overview bg_tablecol_items character color name RGB hex code: background table names form items font_tablecol_items character color name RGB hex code: font color table names form items border_tablecol_items character color name RGB hex code: border table names form items font_hidden character color name RGB hex code: font color hidden forms items bg_select_column character color name RGB hex code: background color 'select' column font_select_column character color name RGB hex code: font color 'select' column border_select_column character color name RGB hex code: font color 'select' border

title: Create a New Data Dictionary Color Theme — add_color_theme
text: new color theme named list, invisibly

title: Create a New Data Dictionary Color Theme — add_color_theme
code: add_color_theme("my_theme",                 template = "purpur",                 bg_primary = "steelblue4",                 font_subtitle = "steelblue4",                 bg_h1 = "steelblue2",                 font_h1 = "#111188")

Default = "G"

title: Add A text paragraph — add_paragraph
text: function merges cells given document (e.g. :G) sets cell style "text_area". Within cell style text wrapped. However Excel fails set correct row height, text added merged cells. function tries estimate right number lines needed display text set row height (extra space end) accordingly.

title: Add A text paragraph — add_paragraph
code: add_paragraph(   wb,   x,   sheet = current_sheet(),   row = 1,   doc_width = "G",   font_weight = 0.86 )

title: Add A text paragraph — add_paragraph
text: wb Workbook object containing worksheet. x (character string) text paragraph sheet worksheet write . Can worksheet index name. row row Date added. Default = 1 doc_width (single character numeric) column texts spread? Default = "G" font_weight (numeric) correction factor estimated number needed lines . Default: 0.86

title: Add A text paragraph — add_paragraph
text: wbWorkbook, invisibly

title: Add A text paragraph — add_paragraph
code: wb <- openxlsx2::wb_workbook() style_datadict(wb) wb$add_worksheet()  p <- paste(   "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy",   "eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam",   "voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Stet",   "clita kasd gubergren, no sea takimata sanctus est Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.")  add_paragraph(wb, p)

text: wb Workbook object containing worksheet. scope "Scope Table", including least scopeID column named "Scope". title (character) title Scope selection table. Default = NULL title = NULL, title created. sheet worksheet write . Can worksheet index name. row number start current Scope Selection, default = 1 doc_width (single character numeric) title given, column section title spread? Default = "G" select_all (logical) "select ?" Question added scope selection table? Default = TRUE ("Select " question added table contains one scope)

text: wbWorkbook, invisibly

title: Clean Excel Region Names — clean_region_name
text: Names named regions following restrictions: first character name must letter underscore character (_). Remaining characters name can letters, numbers, periods, underscore characters. Spaces allowed. Names cell reference, Z$100, BIN9, R1C1.

title: Clean Excel Region Names — clean_region_name
code: clean_region_name(name)

title: Clean Excel Region Names — clean_region_name
text: name (character character vector) name(s) named region

title: Clean Excel Region Names — clean_region_name
text: string (vector) cleaned region names.

title: Clean Excel Region Names — clean_region_name
text: Therefore function replaces punctuation characters like "-" "." replaces white spaces "_" inserts underscore beginning name starts anything else letter underscore name starts "c" name cell reference, "C1", "AB6R12"

title: Clean Excel Region Names — clean_region_name
code: clean_region_name(c("foo-bar", "c19severity", "ad+b 4")) #> [1] "foo.bar"      "_c19severity" "ad.b_4"

title: Create A data dictionary — create_datadict
text: Wrapper function creating data dictionary. function calls: openxlsx2::wb_workbook(), add_form_overview() add_form_sheets()

title: Create A data dictionary — create_datadict
code: create_datadict(   datadict_tables,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   as_of_date = NULL,   form_type_description = TRUE,   doc_width = "G" )

title: Create A data dictionary — create_datadict
text: datadict_tables list tables data dictionary, created create_datadict_tables() title (character) Title document. Default = NULL subtitle (character) subtitle document, e.g. researcher - study name. Default = NULL' as_of_date (date) data set created. Default = NULL form_type_description (logical), short explanation different form types added form overview? Default = TRUE doc_width (single character numeric) column titles texts spread? Default = "G"

title: Create A data dictionary — create_datadict
text: excel workbook

title: Create A data dictionary — create_datadict
code: if (FALSE) create_datadict(datadict_tables) # \dontrun{}

title: Create Data Dictionary Tables — create_datadict_tables
text: Create following tables use data dictionary file: visit form overview casenode forms overview subform (repetition table) overview itemtables form

title: Create Data Dictionary Tables — create_datadict_tables
code: create_datadict_tables(st_metadata, ...)

title: Create Data Dictionary Tables — create_datadict_tables
text: st_metadata list dataset contains secutrial meta data tables. ... <dynamic-dots> additional options pass internal functions. - invert_hidden Boolean, define "hidden" variable question/qs file inverted secutrial bug. option omitted, function assumes bug active 70% questions marked hidden.

title: Create Data Dictionary Tables — create_datadict_tables
text: nested list tibbles following structure:
code: $ form_overview  ...$ visit_forms  ...$ casenode_forms  ...$ sub_forms  ...$ visitarms (only if the study contains multiple visit arms) $ form_items  ...$ <form1>  ...$ <form2>  ...

title: Create Data Dictionary Tables — create_datadict_tables
text: interim calculations refined meta data tables extracted study id saved intermediates environment package. Type: s(stdatadict::intermediates, .names = TRUE) get list objects stored environment. Access object environment: stdatadict::intermediates$<ObjName>.

title: Create Data Dictionary Tables — create_datadict_tables
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() datadict_raw <- create_datadict_tables(st_metadata) }

title: Create a Scope Table — create_scope_table
text: Create table defines variable scopes. table can used adding "Scope"-Column (Selection Rules) form item tables Scope-Selection-Tables workbook.

title: Create a Scope Table — create_scope_table
code: create_scope_table(data, scopeid, ...)

title: Create a Scope Table — create_scope_table
text: data data frame containing variable identifiers (join keys) belong scope. scopeid (character) name/ID Scope. ... <dynamic-dots> named list containing additional information variable Scope. used columns Scope Selection Table workbook.

title: Create a Scope Table — create_scope_table
text: nested tibble decribing Scope

title: Create a Scope Table — create_scope_table
code: scope_data <- scope_data <- data.frame (   mainform = c("form1", "form1", "form2"),   varname_col  = c("var1", "var3", "var10") ) create_scope_table(   scope_data,   "my_scope",   list(Description = "This Scope covers this and that",        visits = "Baseline") ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   Scope    Description                     visits   data             #>   <chr>    <chr>                           <chr>    <list>           #> 1 my_scope This Scope covers this and that Baseline <tibble [3 × 2]>

what: Format Matched Strings In a Text. — fmt_txt_at
title: Format Matched Strings In a Text. — fmt_txt_at
text: Format Matched Strings Text.

title: Format Matched Strings In a Text. — fmt_txt_at
code: fmt_txt_at(text, pattern, ...)

title: Format Matched Strings In a Text. — fmt_txt_at
text: text (character) text contains strings formatted pattern regular expressions, vector regular expressions ... <dynamic-dots> format options pass openxlsx2::fmt_txt(). Can also lists format options length pattern.

title: Format Matched Strings In a Text. — fmt_txt_at
text: openxlsx2 fmt_txt string

title: Format Matched Strings In a Text. — fmt_txt_at
code: shopping_list <- "apples x4, bag of flour, bag of sugar, milk x2"  # format the word 'bag' bold fmt_txt_at(shopping_list, "\\bbag\\b", bold = TRUE) #> fmt_txt string:  #> [1] "apples x4, bag of flour, bag of sugar, milk x2"  # format the x<nr> green and bold and the "bag of" in italic fmt_txt_at(shopping_list,            c("x\\d+", "\\bbag of\\b"),            list(bold = TRUE, color = openxlsx2::wb_color("green")),            list(italic = TRUE)            ) #> fmt_txt string:  #> [1] "apples x4, bag of flour, bag of sugar, milk x2"

what: Get The Creation Date Time Of The Data Export Directory — get_export_date
title: Get The Creation Date Time Of The Data Export Directory — get_export_date
text: function tries extract data creation date time ExportOptions file exported data. However due processing steps reasons ExportOptions file found data directory, return modification time data directory

text: Insert Worksheet Workbook

title: Insert a Worksheet into the Workbook — insert_worksheet
code: insert_worksheet(wb, .after = 0, ...)

title: Insert a Worksheet into the Workbook — insert_worksheet
text: wb wbWorkbook object attach new worksheet .postion sheet inserted. can either sheet name workbook integer specifies sheet position. Set "0" (Default), want insert sheet first. ... <dynamic-dots> additional options pass openxlsx2::wb_add_worksheet()

title: Insert a Worksheet into the Workbook — insert_worksheet
text: wbWorkbook, invisibly

title: Insert a Worksheet into the Workbook — insert_worksheet
code: library(openxlsx2)  ## setup a workbook with 2 worksheets wb <- wb_workbook() wb$add_worksheet("Sheet 1", gridLines = FALSE) wb$add_data_table(sheet = 1, x = iris)  wb$add_worksheet("mtcars (Sheet 2)", gridLines = FALSE) wb$add_data(sheet = 2, x = mtcars)  ## insert a third worksheet after "Sheet 1" insert_worksheet(wb, .after = "Sheet 1", sheet = "Sheet 3", gridLines = FALSE)  ## add data to the inserted sheet wb$add_data(x = Formaldehyde)

title: Add Variable Scopes To Form Item Tables — join_scopes
text: datadict_tables list Scope variable added form_item tables.

title: Add Variable Scopes To Form Item Tables — join_scopes
text: Scope table nested table following format: Scope ID String variable Scope additional Scope Information Variables describe Scope, Scope Label/Name, Description, etc. data table containing variable names identifying variables Scope belongs (joining key variables)

title: Add Variable Scopes To Form Item Tables — join_scopes
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ datadict_tables <- join_scopes(datadict_tables, datapkg_pop_scope) } # }

what: Add Data To Form Item Tables — join_with_form_items
title: Add Data To Form Item Tables — join_with_form_items
text: Wrapper function join data set list data sets form item tables. combines tables datadict_tables$form_items, adds additional data dplyrs inner_join() function. mainform key variable match form name. Keep mind variable names form item tables depend language settings package (Default "en"). independent language setting rename matching key variables following performing join: table_col = Table, question_col = Question, varlab_col = "Variable Label", varname_col = "Variable Name", vartype_col = Type

title: Add Data To Form Item Tables — join_with_form_items
code: join_with_form_items(datadict_tables, data, ...)

title: Add Data To Form Item Tables — join_with_form_items
text: datadict_tables table list, generated create_datadict_tables() data data frame list data framed joined form_item tables datadict_tables ... <dynamic-dots> additional options pass dplyr::left_join()

title: Add Data To Form Item Tables — join_with_form_items
text: datadict_tables joined data form item tables

title: Add Data To Form Item Tables — join_with_form_items
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## create example data for matching extra_data <- form_items %>%   tibble::enframe(name = "mainform") %>%   tidyr::unnest(cols = c(value)) %>%   select(     mainform,     table_col = Table,     varname_col = "Variable Name") %>%   # add random vargroups   mutate(var_group = sample(     x = c("one", "two", NA),     size = nrow(.),     replace = TRUE,     prob = c(0.2, 0.2, 0.6)   )) %>%   filter(!is.na(var_group))  ## add "var_group" to form_items, match by mainform, table and varname datadict_tables <- join_with_form_items(datadict_tables, extra_data) } # }

what: Read Meta Data Files From A SecuTrial or stExport Directory — read_metadata
title: Read Meta Data Files From A SecuTrial or stExport Directory — read_metadata
text: Read following csv files export directory zip file: vp.csv visitplan*.csv vpfs.csv visitplanforms*.csv fs.csv forms*.csv qs.csv questions*.csv cl.csv cl*.csv .csv items*.csv one files present data directory, function exits error message files read. column "hidden" added files: "fs.csv", "qs.csv", ".csv" already exists, functions need column present.

title: Read Meta Data Files From A SecuTrial or stExport Directory — read_metadata
code: read_metadata(data_dir, delim = ";", decimal_mark = ",", encoding = "UTF-8")

title: Read Meta Data Files From A SecuTrial or stExport Directory — read_metadata
text: data_dir Name Directory Zip File SecuTrial tsExport data stored. delim Single character used separate fields within record. decimal_mark Symbol used indicate decimal place. Decimal mark can ⁠,⁠ .. encoding Default encoding. affects file read - readr always converts output UTF-8.

title: Read Meta Data Files From A SecuTrial or stExport Directory — read_metadata
text: List tibbles meta data read SecuTrial tsExport directory zip file.

title: Read Meta Data Files From A SecuTrial or stExport Directory — read_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() data_dir <- file.choose() st_metadata <- read_metadata(data_dir) }

name description color
bg_primary background for document and form titles #990099
font_primary font color for document and form titles #FFFFFF
bg_subtitle background subtitle #FFFFFF
font_subtitle fontcolor subtitle #990099
bg_h1 background heading #E1B5E1
font_h1 fontcolor heading #990099
bg_tablehead background column names #909090
font_tablehead fontcolor column names #FFFFFF
bg_visit background visit names #0066CC
font_visit fontcolor visit names #FFFFFF
bg_tablecol_overview background table names in form overview #FFD530
font_tablecol_overview fontcolor table names in form overview #000000
bg_tablecol_items background table names in form items #CCCCCC
font_tablecol_items fontcolor table names in form items #000000
border_tablecol_items border table names in form items #909090
font_hidden fontcolor hidden forms and items #9696aa
bg_select_column background 'select' column #E1F7EF
font_select_column font color 'select' column and questions #006141
border_select_column border color 'select' column #90E0C5

title: Insert a row in a sheet (emulated) — wb_insert_row
text: wb Workbook object containing worksheet. sheet worksheet insert row(s). Can worksheet index name. Default: current_sheet() insert_row numeric, insert row. Default = 1 nrows many rows inserted. Default = 1 Boolean indicating rows inserted insert_row. Default = FALSE

text: wbWorkbook, invisibly

title: Insert a row in a sheet (emulated) — wb_insert_row
code: library(openxlsx2)  # create workbook wb <- wb_workbook()$ add_worksheet()$  add_data(x = LifeCycleSavings, row_names = TRUE)  # insert two lines above row 4 wb_insert_row(wb, insert_row = 4, nrows = 2)
